Title: ICBC contributes to $1.2 billion syndicated loan to Afreximbank for on-lending purposes in December 2021
Description: On December 21, 2021, the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) signed a $1.2 billion syndicated term loan facility agreement with a group of 22 banks, including the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC). The loan carried a 3-year maturity and unknown interest rate. First Abu Dhabi Bank PJSC, Rand Merchant Bank, a division of FirstRand Bank Limited (London Branch) and Standard Chartered Bank acted as joint Global Coordinators, Mandated Lead Arrangers and Bookrunners on the Facility. Standard Chartered Bank acted as Documentation Agent and is the Facility Agent for the transaction.
Staff Comments: 1. The exact size of ICBC's contribution to the loan syndicate is unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($54,545,454) across the 22 participants in the loan syndicate.
Funding Agencies: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC)
Co-financing Agencies: Absa Bank Limited|Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC (ADCB)|Arab Banking Corporation (Bank ABC)|Bank Muscat|Citibank N.A.|Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft (Commerzbank AG)|Credit Europe Bank|Emirates NBD Bank PJSC|First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB)|Gulf Bank of Kuwait KSCP (Gulf Bank)|HSBC Bank PLC|KDB Bank Europe Limited|Korea Development Bank (KDB)|Mashreqbank PSC|Mizuho Bank|MUFG Bank, Ltd. Title: Chinese Government signs agreement with UN World Food Program to provide food aid to Benin, Liberia and the Republic of Congo in July 2021
Description: On July 29, 2021, the Chinese Government signed an agreement with the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) to provide food aid to Benin, Liberia, and the Republic of Congo. The purpose of this agreement is to provide food assistance to vulnerable groups in the three countries. The agreement indicates that China will use its South-South Cooperation Fund to finance the project and the WFP will help to implement the project. Implementation details have yet to be found.   A signing ceremony was held virtually for this agreement. Luo Zhaohui, the Chairman of the China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA), and David Beasley, the Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP), attended the ceremony and signed the food assistance agreement.
Source Resource Types: Donor/Recipient Official Source|Media Report|Media Report|Donor/Recipient Official Source
Contact Position: Director of the China International Development Cooperation Agency

Title: Chinese Mission to the African Union donates medical supplies to the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa in March 2021
Description: On March 24, 2021, the Chinese Mission to the African Union (AU) donated medical supplies for the prevention and treatment of Covid-19 to the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA). The donation included thermometers, oxygen generators, isolation gowns, ventilators, surgical masks and other personal protective equipments (PPE). The UNECA is located in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
Funding Agencies: Mission of the People's Republic of China to the African Union
Direct Receiving Agencies: United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (ECA)
Source Titles: China donates anti-pandemic medical supplies to UNECA|Ambassador Liu Yuxi and Executive Secretary of the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa Dr. Vera Songwe attended the Anti-pandemic Materials Handover Ceremony

Title: Chinese Government donates 200,000 Sinopharm vaccines worth $3.6 million in February 2021 (Linked to Project ID#97169)
Description: On February 10, 2021, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi confirmed a donation of 200,000 Sinopharm vaccine doses (worth an estimated $3.6 million) on a phone call with Algerian Foreign Minister Boukadoum. The vaccines arrived on February 24, 2021 and were handed over in a ceremony at Algeria's Boufarik military airport (as captured via Project ID#94808).   Then, in September 2021, the Chinese Government donated 3.2 million doses of the Sinovac Covid-19 vaccine worth an estimated $57.6 million (as captured via Project ID#97169).
Staff Comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the February 2021 donation as $3.6 million.

Title: Hubei Health Comission sends 26th medical team to Algeria
Description: In August and Septermber 2021 the 26th medical team sent by the Hubei Health Comission arrived in Algeria. The team had 81 total members split across 8 smaller teams. By June 2022, the medical team had received 72,000 patients, admitted 45,000 hospitalizations, performed 17,000 operations of various types, and delivered 25,000 births. The team also provided medical services to overseas Chinese and employees of Chinese-funded companies.
Source Titles: Ambassador to Algeria Li Jian held a discussion with the Chinese medical team to Algeria

Title: Chinese Government donates 50,000 Sinovac Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $900,000 to CONMEBOL in April 2021
Description: On April 28, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 50,000 donated doses of Sinovac Covid-19 vaccines to La Confederaci¢n Sudamericana de F£tbol (CONMEBOL) in Montevideo, Uruguay. The vaccines were to be distributed among the 10 CONMEBOL member federations for the immunization of the national teams and teams that participate in international competitions and in the first division of each league.
Staff Comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the April 2021 donation as $900,000.2. All member countries within CONMEBOL are ODA eligible recipients

Title: Chinese Government donates COVID-testing laboratory supplies worth USD $77k to CARPHA in October 2021
Description: On October 7th, 2021, the Chinese Government donated COVID-testing laboratory supplies worth USD $77 thousand to the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA). Supplies included 1 dry-ice machine, 60,000 pairs of gloves, 100,000 tips*, 250 plastic autoclavable bags, 5,000 cryovials, and 500 cryo boxes.  The purpose of this donation is to support the Governments and People of CARICOM countries in their continued fight against COVID-19.   *unsure what this is. could be Grenada slang for q tips.
Source Titles: People's Republic of China Continues to Support Caribbean Region in Fight against COVID-19|THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA CONTINUES TO SUPPORT THE CARIBBEAN REGION IN ITS FIGHT AGAINST COVID-19
Source Publishers: Caricom Today|The Caribbean Public Health Agency

Title: China Eximbank provides $79.7 million loan for Phase 2 of the Public Security Project
Description: On December 17, 2021, China Eximbank and the Government of Angola signed a $79.7 million loan agreement for Phase 2 of the Public Security Project. The purpose of this project is to install a network of surveillance (CCTV) cameras in Luanda and various provincial centers and establish various Public Security Integrated Centers to monitor the information that is collected through the surveillance network.    China National Electronics Import and Export Corporation (CEIEC) and Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. are the contractors responsible for project implementation.
Staff Comments: 1. The Portuguese project title is Centro Integrado de Seguranáa P£blica (CISP). 2. It appears that Phase 1 of the Public Security Project, which was underway in 2020, was financed through a credit line with China Eximbank or CDB. This loan may have financed a $243 million commercial contract with CEIEC. This issue warrants further investigation.
Implementing Agencies: China National Electronics Import & Export Corporation (CEIEC)|Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd.
